results.title: Yeni dunyam = My new world
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Yusuf Hazar and ACMI
results.brief_description: Migrating to Australia from Ankara, Turkey in 1978, Yusuf Hazar fondly looks back on the life he and his wife created for his six children. Feeling a deep sense of gratitude to his adopted country, Yusuf and his family are committed to helping out others in the community.

results.title: My second home
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Memet Gunes and ACMI
results.brief_description: Memet Gunes was one of the lucky few people in his village in Turkey to receive an education. When he migrated to Australia with his family he found a place full of possibility and opportunity.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Memet Gunes and ACMI

results.title: Ithal Damat = Imported groom
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Huseyin Duman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Huseyin Damat left Turkey for Australia to meet and marry his wife. Although he was sad to leave his family behind, his journey here was an eventful one, especially when he discovered he was on the same flight as Swedish super group ABBA.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Huseyin Duman and ACMI

results.title: New life new country
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Fatma Coskun and ACMI
results.brief_description: Fatma Coskun came from a small village amongst the mountains of Corun. However, financial hardships drove her and her husband to Australia to start a new life. Despite a major setback at the beginning of their journey, Fatma and her family consider themselves very fortunate to have settled in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Fatma Coskun and ACMI

results.title: Yeni hayat = New life
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Kenan Besiroglu and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kenan Besiroglu migrated to Australia with his wife and son in 1970. This is a story of hard work, perseverance and the promise of a new life.

results.title: Malcolm McKinnon: 6 films for MAP at ACMI
results.brief_description: A collection of six short documentary films from an ongoing project between the filmmaker, Malcolm McKinnon, and small museums in the Wimmera farming region of Victoria. They comprise of local stories told by local people from such areas as Warracknabeal, Rainbow, Murtoa, Brim and Coromby.
results.title_for_label: Malcolm McKinnon: 6 films for MAP at ACMI
results.description: A collection of six short documentary films from an ongoing project between the filmmaker, Malcolm McKinnon, and small museums in the Wimmera farming region of Victoria. They comprise of local stories told by local people from such areas as Warracknabeal, Rainbow, Murtoa, Brim and Coromby.

results.title: Going to my mum's house
results.creator_credit: Debbie Lissek and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’. Debbie lives in a hostel, but spends weekends at her mum’s house. In this story, Debbie gives an outline of the activities she and her mum routinely enjoy on the weekends.

results.title: [Remix: Hats]
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, ACMI Collections and ACMI
results.brief_description:
This playful short film set to music, is a tribute to hats and how we wear them. A remix of home movies and short works in the ACMI Collection featuring styles, shapes and fabrics of hats. Whether at the beach, riding a horse, driving a racing car or going for a swim, a fashionable head-covering is a must. Australian fashion’s best styles of hats for men, women and children from the 1930s to the 1980s are shown.

ACMI gratefully acknowledge the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Tony Agapitos, Karen Wootton, The Gadsden Family, Elenor Peach, Karen Corry, Jenny & Owen Peake, Gil Brealey & Paul Olson and John Richardson.

results.title: Let's not say goodbye
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: The destruction of Australia’s bushland and forests threatens already endangered species. Members of the Theatre in Education and the Real Fantasy Theatre Company take a humorous look at this serious problem.
